commits.message:
Send and Emit Metering Report

This commit adds support for sending a metering report to a billing service. It is expected that the billing client
will not be set in production until a complete billing client is made available in the future. In this case, the report
is sent to the billing client if it is set.

Additionally, a metering report is not always sent to the beholder service. A global beholder client is expected to be
set and a custom metering report message is supplied to the client.

prs.title: ccip - fix log issue related to json encoding
prs.truncated_body:
`Logw` uses json encoding for the provided objects.
If one of the provided objects cannot be json encoded it displays an error.
In this case the provided object was a map with the key being a struct, this cannot be json encoded.
This PR fixes the issue, I checked and no similar issues exists in the codebase.

prs.title: Aleno: Fix logging of confirmedSubscriptions
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

While debugging another issue with Aleno, I noticed that the logged `confirmedSubscriptions` are always `{}`.
`confirmedSubscriptions` is a `Set`, and apparently the logger doesn't log the contents of the set.
So we convert the set to an `Array` before logging it.

## Changes

Pass `confirmedSubscriptions` to `Array.from` before logging it.

prs.title: core,params: Check implied fork times during genesis setup
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

The chain config must have consistent fork times set when OP Stack forks are active that imply Ethereum forks.
This is already guaranteed for chains in the superchain-registry which are loaded via the network flag, or when using the override flags. But checks were missing when a custom genesis.json file is used. So it could happen that a chain operator misconfigures to only set

commits.message:
core,params: Check implied fork times during genesis setup

The chain config must have consistent fork times set when OP Stack forks
are active that imply Ethereum forks.
This is already guaranteed for chains in the superchain-registry which
are loaded via the network flag, or when using the override flags.
But checks were missing when a custom genesis.json file is used. So it
could happen that a chain operator misconfigures to only set e.g.
Isthmus but not the Prague time.

Fixes #586

prs.title: Record data field in JSON RPC Error object
prs.truncated_body:
The JSON RPC Specification includes 3 fields in the Error object: code, message, & data. Currently, the `rpc.jsonError` (in geth) object holds all three fields, but when is turned into a string via `Error`, only the message field is returned.

This causes difficulties when trying to get information from the engine API. The engine API uses the `With` pattern which stores the extra information in

commits.message:
Record data field in JSON RPC Error object

The JSON RPC Specification includes 3 fields in the Error object:
code, message, & data. Currently, the `rpc.jsonError` (in geth)
object holds all three fields, but when is turned into a string
via `Error`, only the message field is returned.

This causes difficulties when trying to get information from the
engine API. The engine API uses the `With` pattern which stores
the extra information in the data field.

This commit checks if the data field exists and if it does,
includes it in the error message.

the deployment.

a usable state for the next test.

prs.title: op-program: Cache executing messages in logs
prs.truncated_body:
During consolidation, cache the result of `ReceiptsToExecutingMessages` to reduce execution cost of the fault proof in the worst case.

For each consolidation round, at most N-1 chains have to be rechecked for invalid messages, where N is the number of chains checked in the previous round. This isn't great when iterating blocks for logs as the number of logs visited can blow up pretty quick. Whi

commits.message:
op-program: Cache constructed executing messages

Save some compute inside the fault proof by avoiding iterating
logs whenever we have to re-consolidate state.

prs.title: op-program: Fix unhandled check errors during consolidation
prs.truncated_body:
Make sure that the op-program does not ignore unexpected errors. All unexpected errors due to invalid chain state should surface as `ErrConflict`, matching op-supervisor semantics for determining when to replace blocks.

fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/14988

commits.message: op-program: Fix unhandled check errors during consolidation

prs.title: feat(evm): save a syscall for most precompile calls
prs.truncated_body:
Previously, we'd query the remaining gas for every precompile call. Now, we only query the remaining gas when actually making a real call (i.e., only in the "native call" precompile.

Unfortunately, we make a syscall to query gas because we don't yet have a way to directly access this information from wasm. Ideally we'd implement https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/discussions/845 and avoid t

commits.message:
feat(evm): save a syscall for most precompile calls

Previously, we'd query the remaining gas for every precompile call. Now,
we only query the remaining gas when actually making a real call (i.e.,
only in the "native call" precompile.

Unfortunately, we make a syscall to query gas because we don't yet have
a way to directly access this information from wasm. Ideally we'd implement
https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/discussions/845 and avoid this
issue entirely, but that's a much larger project.

This should save ~14k gas per pre-compile call, which isn't nothing.
